raw.name: eHNPatientSummaryBody
raw.title: Patient Summary Body
raw.description: A data model representing the Patient Summary Body according to the eHN guidelines.

element.definition: A data model representing the Patient Summary Body according to the eHN guidelines.

element.short: A.2 Patient summary body data elements
element.definition: Structured health information describing alerts, history, observations, and treatments.
Information about allergies or other critical alerts.
Details of known allergies or intolerances.
Textual description of the allergy or intolerance.
This element describes whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance).

Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).
Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.
Potential life-threatening risk from exposure to the allergen.
Date the allergic reaction was observed.
Date the allergy or intolerance was resolved or no longer tracked.
Current status of the allergy or intolerance: active, resolved, etc.
Certainty level regarding the diagnosis of the allergy.
Substance (drug, food, etc.) responsible for the reaction.
Other alerts not included in allergies.

Description of medical alerts in textual format: any clinical information that is imperative to know so that the life or health of the patient does not come under threat. -
Example 1: intolerance to aspirin due to gastrointestinal bleeding.
Example 2: intolerance to captopril because of cough (the patient is not allergic but can't tolerate it because of persistent cough)
Example 3: the patient has a rare disease that requires special treatment
Example 4: Airway Alert / Difficult Intubation
Example 5: Diagnoses such as malignant hyperthermia, porphyria, and bleeding disorders; special treatments like anticoagulants or immunosuppressants; implanted devices.
Example 6: transplanted organs illustrate other information that has to be taken into account in a healthcare contact. 
Example 7: participation in a clinical trial that has to be taken into account in a healthcare contact.
Historical clinical data, including past diseases, vaccines, and treatments.
Details of administered or recorded vaccinations.
Disease or agent protected against by the vaccine.
Generic description of the vaccine or prophylactic agent.
Brand name of the vaccine medicinal product.

element.short: A.2.2.1.3.1 Identifier of the vaccine medicinal product
element.definition: MPID, EMA PMS ID or national vaccine identifier.
Entity holding the marketing authorisation.

element.short: A.2.2.1.5 Number in a series of vaccinations/doses
element.definition: Order number in the vaccine course.
Batch number identifying the vaccine lot.
Date the vaccine was administered.
Name/code of authority that administered the vaccine.
Name/code of the professional who administered the vaccine.
Country where the vaccine was administered.
Planned date for the next dose in the vaccination course.

element.short: A.2.2.2 Resolved, closed or inactive problems
element.definition: Previously resolved or inactive health problems.
Description of a resolved/closed/inactive condition (e.g. hepatic cyst).
Date the problem began.
Date the problem was resolved or marked inactive.

Describes the reason for which the status of the problem changed from current to inactive (e.g. surgical procedure, medical treatment, etc.). This field includes 'free text' if the resolution circumstances are not already included in other fields such as surgical procedure, medical device, etc., e.g. hepatic cystectomy (this will be the resolution circumstances for the problem 'hepatic cyst' and will beincluded in surgical procedures).
Chronological/anecdotal narrative of patient's health history.

This section may provide both synthetic anamnesis (e.g. description of phases of the pathology as a chronological summary of clustered clinical information) and anecdotal evidence that clinicians can collect from the patient, and can read in a narrative form. See Section 2, Chapter III, Art 7, (c).
Current and past diagnoses, conditions, and implants.
Health problems currently affecting the patient.
Current health condition relevant to patient care.
Date the current condition began.
Certainty level or assertion associated with the diagnosis.
Devices impacting the patients health status.
Description of implanted/external devices (e.g. pacemaker).
Standard identifier of the medical device.
Date when device was implanted.
Date when the device was explanted from the patient or the external device was no longer in use; likewise when the device is planned to be explanted.
Relevant past or ongoing procedures.
Description of the procedure.
Target body site of the procedure.
Date the procedure was performed.
Information about patient functional capacity.
Description of how functional status impacts treatment or care.
Onset date of the functional issue.
Textual or structured description of the assessment.
Date the functional assessment was done.
Outcome or result of the functional assessment.
A.2.4 Medication summary

element.short: A.2.4.1 Current and relevant past medicines
element.definition: Relevant prescribed medicines whose period of time indicated for the treatment has not yet expired whether it has been dispensed or not, or medicines that influence current health status or are relevant to a clinical decision

The reason why the medication is or was prescribed, or used
This is the reason why the medication is being prescribed or used. It provides a link to the Past or current health conditions or problems that the patient has had or has.
Indication intended use as: prevention or treatment
Brand name if biological medicinal product or when justified by the health professional (ref. Commission Directive 2012/52/EU)
Substance that alone or in combination with one or more other ingredients produces the intended activity of a medicinal product. Example: "paracetamol"
The content of the active ingredient expressed quantifiably per dosage unit, per unit of volume or per unit of weight, according to the pharmaceutical dose form. Example: 500 mg per tablet
The form in which a pharmaceutical product is presented in the medicinal product package (e.g. tablet, syrup)

Number of units per intake and frequency of intake over a specified duration of time.
Example: 1 tablet every 24h, for 10 days
Path by which the pharmaceutical product is taken into or makes contact with the body.

element.short: A.2.4.1.9 Date of onset of treatment
element.definition: Date when patient needs to start taking the medicine prescribed
A.2.5 Social history

element.short: A.2.5.1 Social history observations related to health
element.definition: Health related lifestyle factors or lifestyle observations and social determinants of health. Example: cigarette smoker, alcohol consumption
Example: from 1974 to 2004
A.2.6 Pregnancy history
A.2.6.1 Current pregnancy status
Date on which the observation of the pregnancy state was made
Provides the woman's current state at the date the observation was made: e.g. pregnant, not pregnant, unknown
Date on which the woman is due to give birth.
A.2.6.2 History of previous pregnancies
Information on the woman's previous pregnancies: Yes, previous pregnancies; No, previous pregnancies; Unknown
A.2.6.2.2 Previous pregnancies description
Date referred to the previous pregnancies outcome
Outcome of the previous pregnancies
Number of children/fetus in this specific pregnancy
A.2.7 Patient provided data
A.2.7.1 Travel history
Country(s) visited
Date of entry and departure
A.2.7.2 Advance Directive
Existence of documentation on living will
A.2.8 Results
A list of observation results pertaining to the subject of care's health condition and which might have impact on future treatments
Date and time of the observation

Observation results types that may be measurements, laboratory results, anatomic pathology results, radiology results or other imaging or clinical results.
Examples:
Diagnostic results (Blood group, Laboratory Observations, Imaging results etc.)
Physical findings (Vital signs observations)
Narrative representation of the observation result and findings.
Observation details including code that identifies observation, specification of the observed body structure or specimen, date and time of the specimen collection.

Result of the observation including numeric and coded results of the measurement, details about how the tests were done to get the result values, information about referential ranges and result interpretation. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.
Identifies the originator/author and provides provenance information about the source of the results data that may have not originated with the source of the whole PS document.
With certain observation results, e.g. there may also be an interpreter or a person responsible for validation.
Therapeutic recommendations that do not include pharmacologic treatments, such as diet, physical exercise, planned surgeries

Narrative containing the plan including proposals, goals, and order requests for monitoring, tracking, or improving the condition of the patient.
In the future it is expected that this Section could be provided in a structured and coded format.

raw.name: eHNPatientSummaryHeader
raw.title: Patient Summary Header
raw.description: A data model representing the Patient Summary Header according to the eHN guidelines.

element.definition: A data model representing the Patient Summary Header according to the eHN guidelines.

element.short: A.1 Patient summary header data elements
element.definition: A.1 Patient summary header data elements
A.1.1 Identification of the patient/subject
Country ID, unique to the patient in that country. Example: ID for Portuguese patient.
The given name/first name of the patient (also known as forename or first name). This field can contain more than one element.
The family name/surname/last name of the patient. This field can contain more than one element or multiple fields could be present.
The date of birth of the patient [ISO TS 22220]. As age of the patient might be important for correct interpretation of test result values, complete date of birth should be provided.
This field must contain a recognised valid value for 'administrative gender'. If different, 'physiological gender' should be communicated elsewhere.
Name of country of affiliation
Patient and health professional contact information.
Detailed structured address of the patient.
Example: Rua dos Campees
Example: 246
Example: Porto
Example: 4500
Example: Vila Nova de Gaia
Example: PT
A.1.2.1.8 Email

This section can be repeated and linked to any specific information in the Patient Summary, for example a link between a rare disease problem (A.2.3.1) and the rare disease specialist responsible for the care of the individual patient (this section).
Name of the Health Professional that has been treating or taking responsibility for the patient.
Health professional role.
Health professional organisation.
Email of the HP/legal organisation.
The HP organization is affiliated with a European network, for example an ERN.
identify the entry or entries of this Patient Summary for which the HP is the preferred contact.
Information about the patient's legal guardian or contact person.
Role of the contact person: legal guardian, next of kin, other person to contact.
Relationship type with the patient (e.g. father, wife, daughter).
The first name of the contact person/guardian (example: Peter). This field can contain more than one element.
This field can contain more than one element. Example: Espaol Smith.
Email of the contact person/legal guardian.
Information related to the patient's insurance.
Example: QQ 12 34 56 A
Metadata about the generation of the patient summary.
Date on which PS was generated.
Date on which PS was updated (date of most recent version).

Defines the context in which it was generated. Distinguishes between three methodological approaches for generating the PS: direct human intervention by an HP, automatically generated approach and mixed approach.
The individual or organization responsible for authoring the Patient Summary.

At least one Author and Organisation shall be listed. In the event that there is no Author, at least one Organisation shall be listed This Author should be able to provide further information on the provenance of the data present in the patient summary. Different authors contributing to individual sections and/or entries could be provided at the relevant level.
Legal entity (Health Professional or Provider) who authenticated the summary.
References to external knowledge resources relevant to the Patient Summary.

A reference leading to Clinical Practice Guidelines (CPG), emergency and anesthesia guidelines or other clinical relevant guidelines. This should be used only for providing specific guidance which may not be readily available to the health professional caring for the patient.

Identify the entry or entries of this Patient Summary for which this additional information relates with, for example a link between a rare disease problem (section A.2.3.1) and guidelines for that particular rare disease (this section).

raw.name: EHDSPatientSummary
raw.title: Patient summary model
raw.description: EHDS refined base model for Patient Summary

element.definition: EHDS refined base model for Patient Summary
TO_DO
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. The element name is taken from MyHealth@EU specification and is the same in ISO IPS and FHIR IPS IG. The name in eHN PS GL  for this element is simply 'Allergy', and that was considered less inclusive compared to the alternative.

element.short: Generated text summary of the content in section, for human interpretation
element.definition: Generated text summary of the content in section, for human interpretation
element.requirements: The element is present in FHIR IPS IG. See general description of Patient summary modelling for more information about this element.

element.short: Use if no Allergies are listed
element.definition: Reason for absence of data (indicates whether the person is known to have no allergies or the data is considered incomplete)

element.short: List of structured allergies and intolerances
element.definition: List of structured allergies and intolerances
element.requirements: This element is present in MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. The proposed way of modelling is identical to the newest version of FHIR IPS IG. See general description of Patient summary modelling for more information about this element. MH@EU has a similar concept, but it is modelled in slightly different way.

element.definition: Conditions that are important to be known for a health professional during a health encounter.

element.short: Generated text summary of the content in the section, for human interpretation
element.definition: Generated text summary of the content in the section, for human interpretation

element.short: Use if no conditions are listed
element.definition: Use if no conditions are listed

element.short: !!Health conditions affecting the health of the patient.!!
element.definition: !!Health conditions affecting the health of the patient.!!
Current and relevant past medicine.

element.short: Generated text summary of the content in the section, for human interpretation
element.definition: Generated text summary of the content in the section, for human interpretation

element.short: Use if no medicines are listed
element.definition: Use if no medicines are listed

element.short: Medication treatment/prescription relevant for this patient summary. Typically, medications whose period of time indicated for the treatment has not yet expired whether it has been dispensed or not.
element.definition: Medication treatment/prescription relevant for this patient summary. Typically, medications whose period of time indicated for the treatment has not yet expired whether it has been dispensed or not.
Section: Medical devices and implants

element.short: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
element.definition: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
Reason for absence of data

element.short: Describes the patient's implanted and external medical devices and equipment that their health status depends on. Includes devices (such as cardiac pacemakers, implantable defibrillator, prothesis, ferromagnetic bone implants etc.) that are important to know by the HP.
element.definition: Describes the patient's implanted and external medical devices and equipment that their health status depends on. Includes devices (such as cardiac pacemakers, implantable defibrillator, prothesis, ferromagnetic bone implants etc.) that are important to know by the HP.
Section: Procedures

element.short: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
element.definition: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
Reason for absence of data

element.short: List of procedures Textual description of the procedure. Describes the type of the procedure, surgical or non-surgical .
element.definition: List of procedures Textual description of the procedure. Describes the type of the procedure, surgical or non-surgical .

A patient's immunization status. The section should include current immunization status and may contain the entire immunization history that is relevant to the period of time being summarized. Adverse reactions against vaccines should be documented in the allergy section.

element.short: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
element.definition: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section

element.short: Immunizations given to the patient and their status at the point of care.
element.definition: Immunizations given to the patient and their status at the point of care.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline

element.definition: This section may provide both synthetic anamnesis (e.g. description of phases of the pathology as a chronological summary of clustered clinical information) and anecdotal evidence that clinicians can collect from the patient, and can read in a narrative form.

element.short: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
element.definition: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section

element.short: Problems or diagnoses that the patient suffered in the past, and which have been resolved, closed or declared as inactive (not included in current problems or diagnosis)
element.definition: Problems or diagnoses that the patient suffered in the past, and which have been resolved, closed or declared as inactive (not included in current problems or diagnosis)
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline

element.definition: Information about substantial alerts or warnings that health professionals should be aware of.
Section: Functional status
Observations on social factors such as alcohol consumption or smoking. From the healthcare perspective, life-style factors relate to well-being but can also provide a source of risk factors.

element.short: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
element.definition: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section

element.short: Textual description of the social history.
element.definition: Textual description of the social history.
Section: Pregnancy history

element.short: captures relevant information about the patient's recent travel history that may be of clinical relevance  particularly in relation to exposure to infectious diseases, epidemiological risks, or environmental factors. The intent is to support clinical decision-making and risk assessment, especially in contexts such as outbreaks or endemic disease regions.
element.definition: captures relevant information about the patient's recent travel history that may be of clinical relevance  particularly in relation to exposure to infectious diseases, epidemiological risks, or environmental factors. The intent is to support clinical decision-making and risk assessment, especially in contexts such as outbreaks or endemic disease regions.
Provision for healthcare decisions if, in the future, a person is unable to make those decisions.
Relevant observation results obtained on the patient. These may be measurements, laboratory results, anatomic pathology results, radiology results or other imaging or clinical results.

element.short: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
element.definition: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the section
Therapeutic recommendations that do not include pharmacologic treatments, such as diet, physical exercise, planned surgeries

element.short: Narrative containing the plan including proposals, goals, and order requests for monitoring, tracking, or improving the condition of the patient. In the future it is expected that this Section could be provided in a structured and coded format.
element.definition: Narrative containing the plan including proposals, goals, and order requests for monitoring, tracking, or improving the condition of the patient. In the future it is expected that this Section could be provided in a structured and coded format.

raw.name: EHDSDataSet
raw.title: DataSet model
raw.description: Common elements (including header) for all documents and their independently functioning parts, e.g FHIR resources.

element.definition: Common elements (including header) for all documents and their independently functioning parts, e.g FHIR resources.

element.short: Common header for all patient-related data
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data
Patient/subject information
Business identifier for the object
Resource authoring details
Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.
Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

element.short: Date and time of the last update to the resource
element.definition: Date and time of the last update to the document/information
Status of the resource

element.short: Reason for the current status of the resource.
element.definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.
Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
Business version of the resource.

element.short: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document
element.definition: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

raw.name: EHDSDocument
raw.title: Document model
raw.description: EHDS refined base model for common document data elements, including the common header. Data relevant to document type and its content for administrative and searching purposes.

element.definition: EHDS refined base model for common document data elements, including the common header. Data relevant to document type and its content for administrative and searching purposes.
Unique identifier of the document
Identifies the type of document at hand, e.g. Hospital discharge report.
Document title, such as Hospital Discharge Report, Laboratory Result Report, etc.
The status of the Hospital discharge report. E.g., preliminary, final.
Time of service that is being documented
Document attestation details
Attester who validated the document. Mulitple attesters could be provided.
Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester.
Document legal authentication
The person taking responsibility for the medical content of the document
Date and time when the document was authorized.

Categorization of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement betwen data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purpuses.
Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)
Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.
An identifier of the document constraints, encoding, structure, and template that the document conforms to beyond the base format indicated in the mimeType.
Level of confidentiality of the document. Implicit value is normal.
Related documents and information sources

raw.name: EHDSPSAllergyIntolerance
raw.title: Allergy intolerance model
raw.description: EHDS refined base model for allergy/intolerance

element.definition: EHDS refined base model for allergy/intolerance

element.short: Agent or allergen to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity
element.definition: A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.24 **eHDSIActiveIngredient** (ATC, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.61 eHDSISubstance (EMA SMS, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.19 eHDSIAllergenNoDrug (SCT, used in MH@EU); ICD-11 Allergens

element.short: Whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)
element.definition: Whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL and MyHealth@EU specifications. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.18 eHDSIAdverseEventType (SCT, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergy-intolerance-type (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.short: Textual description of the allergy or intolerance
element.definition: Textual description of the allergy or intolerance
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL and ISO IPS specifications. Element description is taken from eHN PS GL. The name was shortened to Description, from eHN PS GL 'Allergy description' and ISO IPS 'Allergy/Intolerance description'.

element.short: Potential risk for future life-threatening adverse reactions when exposed to a substance known to cause an adverse reaction.
element.definition: Potential risk for future life-threatening adverse reactions when exposed to a substance known to cause an adverse reaction.
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name is taken from eHN PS GL, and is the same in MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS, while the description is taken from FHIR IPS as the description from PS GL implied use case and inclusion of specific values which might not be appropriate in all use cases.

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.57 eHDSICriticality (HL7, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergy-intolerance-criticality (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.short: Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
element.definition: Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.58 eHDSIAllergyCertainty (HL7, used in MH@EU) ; http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergyintolerance-verification (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.short: Current status of the allergy or intolerance, for example, whether it is active, in remission, resolved, etc.
element.definition: Current status of the allergy or intolerance, for example, whether it is active, in remission, resolved, etc.
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.59 eHDSIAllergyStatus (HL7, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergyintolerance-clinical (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.definition: Date of onset of allergy, e.g., date of the first observation of the reaction. Partial date could be used.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS

element.short: Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)
element.definition: Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MH@EU

element.short: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction including date of manifestation and severity. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).
element.definition: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction including date of manifestation and severity. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).
element.requirements: ISO IPS (explicit), implicitly in eHN PS Guideline, MH@EU

element.short: Clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.
element.definition: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL. Cardinality in MyHealth@EU for this element is one manifestation per severity and onset, while the cardinality in

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.5 eHDSIIllnessandDisorder (ICD-10, alternative in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.11 eHDSIReactionAllergy (SCT, alternative in MH@EU); ICD-11

element.short: Date and time of allergy manifestation
element.definition: Date and time of allergy manifestation

element.short: Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.
element.definition: Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.13 eHDSISeverity (SCT, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/reaction-event-severity (HL7, Required in HL7 FHIR)

element.short: ????Description of the event as a whole???
element.definition: ????Description of the event as a whole???

element.short: Date of the observation of the reaction
element.definition: Date of the observation of the reaction
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

raw.name: EHDSImmunization
raw.title: Immunization model
raw.description: C.24 - EHDS refined base model for Immunization

element.definition: C.24 - EHDS refined base model for Immunization
Indicates the current status of the immunization event (completed, not-done).
Disease or agent that the vaccination provides protection against.
Generic description of the vaccine/prophylaxis or its component(s).

binding.description: SNOMED CT, ATC (IDMP/ EMA SPOR SMS)

element.definition: Medicinal product administered.

element.short: Number in a series of vaccinations / doses
element.definition: Order in the vaccination course.
The date and time when the vaccination was administered
Name/code of administering centre or a health authority responsible for the vaccination event
Name or health professional code responsible for administering the vaccine or prophylaxis
The date when the vaccination is planned to be given/repeated (e.g. next dose)

raw.name: EHDSCondition
raw.title: Condition model
raw.description: Health conditions affecting the health of the patient and are important to be known for a health professional during a health encounter.

element.definition: Health conditions affecting the health of the patient and are important to be known for a health professional during a health encounter.

element.short: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis. Coded values are preferable, but text should be accepted.
element.definition: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis. Coded values are preferable, but text should be accepted.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.5 eHDSIIllnessandDisorder (ICD-10, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.63 eHDSIRareDisease (OrphaCodes, used in MH@EU); ICD-11; SNOMED CT

element.short: Assertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
element.definition: Assertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.64 eHDSICertainty (HL7, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/condition-ver-status (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.definition: Onset date of a problem/condition
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS

element.definition: The date (or estimated date) that the condition resolved or went into remission.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS

element.short: Describes the reason for which the status of the problem changed from current to inactive (e.g. surgical procedure, medical treatment, etc.).
element.definition: This field includes free text if the resolution circumstances are not already included in other fields such as surgical procedure, medical device, etc., e.g. hepatic cystectomy (this will be the resolution circumstances for the problem 'hepatic cyst' and will be included in surgical procedures).
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline

element.short: The clinical status of the condition
element.definition: The clinical status of the condition
element.requirements: ISO IPS, MH@EU, (implicit eHN PS Guideline)

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.15 eHDSIStatusCode (SCT, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/condition-clinical (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.short: Subjective assessment of the severity of the condition.
element.definition: Subjective assessment of the severity of the condition.
element.requirements: ISO IPS, MH@EU

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.13 eHDSISeverity (SCT, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/condition-severity (SCT, Preferred in HL7 FHIR); Basic 3-Value Severity Scale Value: Mild-Moderate-Severe http://id.who.int/icd/entity/681697550 (ICD-11)

element.short: Health Professional who may be specifically related to the problem, as a preferred contact.
element.definition: Health Professional who may be specifically related to the problem, as a preferred contact.
element.requirements: ISO IPS, MH@EU

element.short: External Resource which may be specifically related to the problem, for example a link between a rare disease problem and the corresponding guidelines.
element.definition: External Resource which may be specifically related to the problem, for example a link between a rare disease problem and the corresponding guidelines.
element.requirements: MH@EU

raw.name: EHDSPSMedicationStatement
raw.title: Medication Statement
raw.description: Entry in a Medication Summary or overview.

element.definition: Entry in a Medication Summary or overview.

element.short: Autogenerated human readable text created from all structured and unstructured information elements related to dosage and dosage instructions.
element.definition: Autogenerated human readable text created from all structured and unstructured information elements related to dosage and dosage instructions.

element.short: The current status of the taking of medicine.
element.definition: The current status of the taking of medicine.
element.requirements: MH@EU

element.short: The medication that is being administered or has been administered.
element.definition: The medication that is being administered or has been administered.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MH@EU

element.short: Coded or text reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, or a procedure)
element.definition: This is the reason why the medication is being prescribed or used. It provides a link to the Past or current health conditions or problems that the patient has had or has. [IPS].

element.short: The intended use of the medication, e.g. prophylactic, therapeutic, diagnostic, anesthesia, etc.
element.definition: The intended use of the medication, e.g. prophylactic, therapeutic, diagnostic, anesthesia, etc.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, MH@EU

element.short: Number of units per intake and frequency of intake over a specified duration of time
element.definition: Number of units per intake and frequency of intake over a specified duration of time. Example: 1 tablet every 24h, for 10 days .
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MH@EU

element.short: Date when patient needs to start taking the medicine prescribed
element.definition: Date when patient needs to start taking the medicine prescribed. This information may be expressed using start and end date times OR indicating the duration. The first is used to indicate a specified interval (e.g., from March 15th, 2017); the latter for indicating a 'floating' period (e.g., 2 weeks). In case of unbounded period (continuous therapy), the end element will be valued with an exceptional value.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MH@EU

raw.name: EHDSHumanName
raw.title: Human name model
raw.description: C.27 - EHDS refined base model for Human name

element.definition: C.27 - EHDS refined base model for Human name
Identifies the purpose for this name.

element.short: Written name as is should be displayed
element.definition: Specifies the entire name as it should be displayed e.g. on an application UI. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.
The family name/surname/last name of the patient. This field can contain more than one  element or multiple fields could be present.
The given name/first name  (also known as forename or first name).

element.short: Name Prefix e.g. Sir, Rev., Prof.
element.definition: Name parts that come before the name. Prefixes appear in the correct order for presenting the name.
Name parts that come after the name. Suffixes appear in the correct order for presenting the name.

raw.name: EHDSPatient
raw.title: Patient model
raw.description: C.1 - EHDS refined base model for Patient/subject information

element.definition: C.1 - EHDS refined base model for Patient/subject information
An identifier of the patient that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National ID (birth number) or National patient identifier for the Czech patient. Multiple identifiers may be provided.
Name associated with the patient/subject. Name might consist of name parts, e.g. Given name or names, family name/surname, name prefix etc.
The date of birth of the patient [ISO TS 22220]. As age of the patient might be important for correct interpretation of the test result values, complete date of birth should be provided.
This field must contain a recognized valid value for 'administrative gender'. If different, 'physiological gender' should be communicated elsewhere.

Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, ZIP code, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Telecommunication contact information (addresses) associated to a person. Multiple telecommunication addresses might be provided.
Marital (civil) status of a patient
Citizenship/nationality of the patient.
The language which can be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.

raw.name: EHDSAddress
raw.title: Address model
raw.description: EHDS refined base model for Address structure

element.definition: EHDS refined base model for Address structure
Purpose of the address

element.short: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.
element.definition: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.
Text representation of the address
Name of the street
House number
Post box
City
Postal code
Country name and country code

raw.name: EHDSTelecom
raw.title: Telecom model
raw.description: C.6 - EHDS refined base model for Telecommunication contact information structure

element.definition: C.6 - EHDS refined base model for Telecommunication contact information structure
Purpose of the address
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication type (i.e. phone number or email address).
